snp4.10:6.4: Agreeing with Norman that this is a rare instance of _saddha_ in the sense of wish, desire, per Sanskrit _śraddhā_, one sense of which is “appetite”.
snp4.10:11.3: As in [snp4.3:8.3]() this makes better sense considered as an active process.
snp4.10:14.3: Given the significance of “views” in the Aṭṭhakavagga, and that _dhamma_ is commonly used in the sense of “teaching”, I read this in view of such passages as [mn47:14.3](): _dhammesu niṭṭhaṁ gacchati_ (“comes to a conclusion about the teachings”).
